contentrichtext.text: {{about|the municipality in [[Nordland]], [[Norway]]|the place in [[Ski, Norway|Ski]], [[Akershus]]|Langhus}} {{Infobox kommune | name = Vevelstad | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 1816 | image_skyline = | county = Nordland | district = Helgeland | capital = Vevelstad | language = [[Bokmål]] | coatofarms = Vevelstad komm.svg | demonym = Vevelstadværing | munwebpage = www.vevelstad.kommune.no | mayor = Ken-Richard Hansen | mayor_party = [[Centre Party (Norway)|Sp]] | mayor_as_of = 2003 | area_rank = 198 | area_total_km2 = 538.83 | area_land_km2 = 517.14 | area_water_km2 = 21.69 | population_as_of = 2011 | population_rank = 427 | population_total = 520 | population_density_km2 = 1.0 | population_increase = -9.7 | latd = 65 | latm = 40 | lats = 6 | longd = 12 | longm = 31 | longs = 7 | utm_zone = 33W | utm_northing = 7285203 | utm_easting = 0385951 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} '''Vevelstad''' is a [[List of municipalities of Norway|municipality]] in [[Nordland]] [[Counties of Norway|county]], [[Norway]]. It is part of the [[Helgeland]] [[Districts of Norway|traditional region]]. The [[administrative centre]] of the municipality is the village of [[Forvika]]. ==General information== [[File:Velfjorden.JPG|thumb|left|300px|View of the [[Velfjorden]], Vevelstad is on the left side of the fjord.]] The municipality of Vevelstad was established on 1 July 1916 when it was separated from the municipality of [[Tjøtta]]. Initially, the municipality had 1,097 residents. On 1 July 1920, the Giskåen farm area (population: 10) was transferred from [[Tjøtta]] to Vevelstad.<ref>{{cite web|first=Dag|last=Jukvam|publisher=[[Statistics Norway|Statistisk sentralbyrå]]|title=Historisk oversikt over endringer i kommune- og fylkesinndelingen|year=1999|url=http://www.ssb.no/emner/00/90/rapp_9913/rapp_9913.pdf|language=Norwegian}}</ref> ===Name=== The municipality (originally the [[parish]]) is named after the old ''Vevelstad'' farm ([[Old Norse]]: ''Vifilsstaðir''), since the first church was built there. The first element is the [[genitive case]] of the Norse male name ''Vifill'' and the last element is ''staðir'' which means "[[wikt:homestead|homestead]]" or "[[farm]]".<ref>{{cite book|title=Norske gaardnavne: Nordlands amt|edition=16|authorlink=Oluf Rygh|last=Rygh|first=Oluf|publisher=W. C. Fabritius & sønners bogtrikkeri|date=1905|location=Kristiania, Norge|page=51|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=K21BAAAAIAAJ|language=Norwegian}}</ref> ===Coat-of-arms=== The [[Coat of arms|coat-of-arms]] is from modern times; they were granted on 13 November 1991. The arms are [[canting arms|canting]], showing the first letter of the name, [[V]]. The municipality already applied for arms in the 1970s, but all the proposals were rejected by either the council or the national archives. Finally the above arms were adopted and granted.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ngw.nl/int/nor/v/vevelsta.htm|author=Norske Kommunevåpen|year=1990|title=Nye kommunevåbener i Norden|accessdate=2008-11-30}}</ref> ===Churches=== The [[Church of Norway]] has one parish ''(sokn)'' within the municipality of Vevelstad. It is part of the [[List of churches in Nordland#Sør-Helgeland prosti|Sør-Helgeland]] [[deanery]] in the [[Diocese of Sør-Hålogaland]]. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ style="font-size:medium"|'''''Churches in Vevelstad''''' !Parish<br />(Sokn)!!Church Name!!Location<br />of the Church!!Year Built |- |Vevelstad||[[Vevelstad Church]]||Vevelstad||1796 |} ==Geography== The municipality lies in the middle of Norway, surrounded by mountains and [[fjord]]s. A lot of the municipality is a part of [[Lomsdal–Visten National Park]]. The lake [[Søre Vistvatnet]] lies in the southeastern part of the municipality inside the national park. Most of the residents live along the coastline or on the island [[Hamnøya, Vevelstad|Hamnøya]]. The mouth of the [[Velfjorden]] lies in the southern part of the municipality. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Vevelstad}} *{{Wikivoyage-inline|Nordland}} *[http://www.ssb.no/english/municipalities/1816 Municipal fact sheet] from [[Statistics Norway]] * http://oklausse.home.online.no/vevelstad/ {{Nordland}} [[Category:Municipalities of Nordland]] [[Category:Villages in Nordland]] [[Category:Vevelstad| ]]
